segments.text: The girl is just standing there, watching her brother risk his neck for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so happy, like she doesn’t even realize how dangerous this is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far—he’s going to fall and hurt himself!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the sink is making everything worse, and the woman is just drying dishes like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless she is—she’s standing in a puddle and doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is about to tip, and the kids are too distracted to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to this chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone will ever notice the mess before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on the cookies that he doesn’t see how close he is to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is just waiting to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
